required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of FKB238 and Avastin in Patients With Advanced/Recurrent Non-squamous Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Parallel, Double Blinded Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of FKB238 to Avastin® In 1st Line Treatment for Patients With Advanced/Recurrent Non Squamous NSCLC in Combination of Paclitaxel and Carboplatin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to compare the effectiveness and safety of FKB238 against Avastin® in men and women with advanced/recurrent non squamous non-small cell lung cancer

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) Assessed as the Proportion of Patients With a Best Overall Response (BOR) of Either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
primary_outcome.description: The primary variable in this study was ORR, defined as the proportion of patients with a BOR of CR or PR (by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v1.1)). A BOR was defined as the best response (in the order of CR, PR, stable disease (SD), no evidence of disease (NED), progressive disease (PD), and not evaluable (NE)) among all post-baseline disease assessments that occurred until progression, or last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression prior to the initiation of subsequent anti-cancer therapy, irrespective of whether or not patients discontinued the study treatment. The 95% Pearson-Clopper confidence interval (CI) of ORR for each treatment arm was provided. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by computed tomography (CT) or, if contraindicated, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. Overall Response=CR+PR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization up to Week 19.
secondary_outcome.description: ORR (by RECIST v1.1) at Week 19 was defined as the proportion of patients with a BOR of CR or PR assessed at Week 19. Only tumor assessments performed up until 19 weeks (i.e. Week 18 assessment + 7 day assessment window) from randomization were considered in this analysis. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. Overall Response=CR+PR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The event of interest for PFS was defined as the interval from the date of randomization until first documented disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs first. Disease progression was based on tumor assessments according to RECIST v1.1 criteria. The items of the overall response CR, PR, SD and NED were taken as progression-free whereas PD denoted disease progression. PFS was summarized using Kaplan-Meier estimates of the quartiles for each treatment arm, and 95% CIs for the medians were calculated. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: PD=at least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, or the appearance of one or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The event of interest was defined as death from any cause. OS was defined as the interval from date of randomization until the date of death due to any cause. OS was summarized using Kaplan-Meier estimates of the quartiles for each treatment arm, and 95% CIs for the medians were calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
secondary_outcome.description: DOR was evaluated in this study as a secondary efficacy endpoint. Only the patients defined as responders in the primary analysis of ORR were taken into account for the analysis of DOR. The event of interest was defined as first documented disease progression or death due to any reason, whichever occurred first. DOR was defined as the interval from the first documented response (as defined per RECIST v1.1) until the earlier date of the first documented disease progression or death due to any reason. The date of first documented response was taken as the date of the first tumor assessment with an overall visit response of CR or PR. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. DOR was calculated in units of months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate (DCR) Assessed as the Proportion of Patients With a BOR of Either CR, PR, SD or NED
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The DCR was defined as the proportion of patients defined as responders. The number and percentage of responders and non-responders and the 95% Pearson-Clopper CI of DCR for each treatment arm was provided. The odds ratio for treatment (FKB238 arm versus Avastin arm) and the corresponding 95% Wald CI were produced based on a logistic regression analysis of DCR. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions; SD=neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum of diameters while on study. DCR=CR+PR+SD (≥ 6 weeks).

other_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 (pre- and post-infusion), Cycle 2 Day 1 (pre), Cycle 4 Day 1 (pre and post), Cycle 6 Day 1 (pre), discontinuation visit, and every 12 weeks (up to 1 year [±14 days] after randomisation) until death, or the patient was lost to follow-up.
other_outcome.description: Ctrough (pre-infusion) and serum maximum concentration (Cmax; at completion of infusion) were compared between treatment arms and time points, and descriptive statistics provided. Ctrough and Cmax concentrations were summarized using the pharmacokinetics (PK) population for each visit at which samples were taken. The pre-dose serum concentrations at Cycles 2, 4, and 6 were considered as Ctrough values and the post-dose serum concentrations at Cycles 1 and 4 were considered as Cmax values. PK data at Cycle 1 Day 1 pre-infusion were not calculable and are therefore not presented in the outcome measure data table. Data are only provided for the time points at which the serum trough concentration was measured.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Developing Anti-drug Antibodies (ADAs)
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Cycles 1, 2, 4 and 6, discontinuation visit, and every 12 weeks (up to 1 year [±14 days] after randomisation) until death, or the patient was lost to follow-up, whichever occurred first.
other_outcome.description: The ADA levels were summarized at baseline and post-baseline time points using descriptive statistics.

other_outcome.time_frame: From the time of signature of informed consent, throughout the treatment period and up to and including the 30-days after the last dose of study treatment, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.
Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.
Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.
Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.
Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Eastern Collaborative Oncology Group Performance Status
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.
Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

arm_group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: Area Under Curve (AUC) = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles.

Drug: Avastin: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 years or older
- Newly diagnosed advanced (stage IV) /recurrent non-squamous NSCLC for which they had not received any systemic anti-cancer therapy for metastatic disease
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of predominantly non-squamous NSCLC
- Existence of at least 1 measurable lesion by RECIST v1.1
- Adequate hematological, renal and liver function
- Eastern Collaborative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS) 0 or 1
- Life expectancy longer than 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) or combination SCLC and NSCLC. Squamous-cell tumors and mixed adenosquamous carcinomas of predominantly squamous nature
- Any unresolved toxicities from prior systemic therapy
- Known sensitizing epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) mutations or echinoderm microtubule-associated protein-like 4-anaplastic lymphoma kinase (EML4-ALK) translocation positive mutations
- Previous dosing with vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) inhibitor
- Known hypersensitivity to any excipients of the Investigational Products (IPs) and combination chemotherapy
- Use of prohibited concomitant medication
- Known Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection
- Fertile men or women of childbearing potential not using adequate contraception.
Other inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Research Site 7814 - Compassionate Care Research Group
Research Site 7811 - Innovative Clinical Research Institute
Research Site 7812 - Joliet Oncology-Hematology Associates, Ltd.
Research Site 7810 - Edward H. Kaplan, MD and Associates
Research Site 7813 - Trinity Cancer Care Center
Research Site 7805 - Hematology & Oncology Associates, Inc.
Research Site 7804 - Tri-County Hematology & Oncology Associates, Inc.
Research Site 7806 - Vista Oncology Inc. PS

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Screening occurred at 146 centers in 24 countries (randomized at 136 centers, 24 countries) in Belarus, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Georgia, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Japan, South Korea, Peru, Philippines, Poland, Romania, Russia, Serbia, Spain, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, Ukraine, US and Vietnam. No screening occurred in Canada.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of a total of 1023 patients who signed informed consent and were screened, 292 patients were not randomized. Of the 731 randomized patients, 2 patients were randomized in error and never received any study treatment, and 1 patient was randomized but withdrew consent prior to receiving any study treatment.

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) Assessed as the Proportion of Patients With a Best Overall Response (BOR) of Either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
outcome.description: The primary variable in this study was ORR, defined as the proportion of patients with a BOR of CR or PR (by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v1.1)). A BOR was defined as the best response (in the order of CR, PR, stable disease (SD), no evidence of disease (NED), progressive disease (PD), and not evaluable (NE)) among all post-baseline disease assessments that occurred until progression, or last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression prior to the initiation of subsequent anti-cancer therapy, irrespective of whether or not patients discontinued the study treatment. The 95% Pearson-Clopper confidence interval (CI) of ORR for each treatment arm was provided. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by computed tomography (CT) or, if contraindicated, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. Overall Response=CR+PR.
outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
outcome.population: In order to meet the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requirement, the primary efficacy analysis of ORR was performed using the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized), and the blinded independent central review (BICR) radiological assessments.

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

measure.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) Assessed as the Proportion of Patients With a Best Overall Response (BOR) of Either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
measure.description: The primary variable in this study was ORR, defined as the proportion of patients with a BOR of CR or PR (by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v1.1)). A BOR was defined as the best response (in the order of CR, PR, stable disease (SD), no evidence of disease (NED), progressive disease (PD), and not evaluable (NE)) among all post-baseline disease assessments that occurred until progression, or last evaluable assessment in the absence of progression prior to the initiation of subsequent anti-cancer therapy, irrespective of whether or not patients discontinued the study treatment. The 95% Pearson-Clopper confidence interval (CI) of ORR for each treatment arm was provided. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by computed tomography (CT) or, if contraindicated, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. Overall Response=CR+PR.
measure.population: In order to meet the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requirement, the primary efficacy analysis of ORR was performed using the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized), and the blinded independent central review (BICR) radiological assessments.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A 90% CI for the ORR ratio between FKB238 and Avastin was estimated and compared to the margin (0.73 to 1.38), which was deemed to represent a clinically acceptable difference with respect to ORR. If the 90% CI was within the equivalence margin (0.73 to 1.38), an equivalence between FKB238 and Avastin, with respect to the ORR, was confirmed.

outcome.title: ORR at Week 19
outcome.description: ORR (by RECIST v1.1) at Week 19 was defined as the proportion of patients with a BOR of CR or PR assessed at Week 19. Only tumor assessments performed up until 19 weeks (i.e. Week 18 assessment + 7 day assessment window) from randomization were considered in this analysis. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. Overall Response=CR+PR.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization up to Week 19.
outcome.population: In order to meet the FDA requirement, the secondary efficacy analysis of ORR was performed using the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized), and the BICR radiological assessments.

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

measure.title: ORR at Week 19
measure.description: ORR (by RECIST v1.1) at Week 19 was defined as the proportion of patients with a BOR of CR or PR assessed at Week 19. Only tumor assessments performed up until 19 weeks (i.e. Week 18 assessment + 7 day assessment window) from randomization were considered in this analysis. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. Overall Response=CR+PR.
measure.population: In order to meet the FDA requirement, the secondary efficacy analysis of ORR was performed using the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized), and the BICR radiological assessments.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between groups: Risk ratio in ORR at Week 19 by BICR.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Ratio in ORR analysis of FKB238 versus Avastin.

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: The event of interest for PFS was defined as the interval from the date of randomization until first documented disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs first. Disease progression was based on tumor assessments according to RECIST v1.1 criteria. The items of the overall response CR, PR, SD and NED were taken as progression-free whereas PD denoted disease progression. PFS was summarized using Kaplan-Meier estimates of the quartiles for each treatment arm, and 95% CIs for the medians were calculated. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: PD=at least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
outcome.population: This assessment was performed using the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized) and the BICR radiological assessments.

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

group.title: Avastin / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: Avastin: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Avastin (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: The event of interest for PFS was defined as the interval from the date of randomization until first documented disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs first. Disease progression was based on tumor assessments according to RECIST v1.1 criteria. The items of the overall response CR, PR, SD and NED were taken as progression-free whereas PD denoted disease progression. PFS was summarized using Kaplan-Meier estimates of the quartiles for each treatment arm, and 95% CIs for the medians were calculated. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: PD=at least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions, or the appearance of one or more new lesions.
measure.population: This assessment was performed using the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized) and the BICR radiological assessments.

analysis.groups_desc: Hazard ratio and its 95% CI were calculated using the Cox regression model adjusting for baseline characteristics (randomization stratification factors, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status at baseline, gender, smoking history and age) with ties handled by the Efron method.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Hazard ratio analysis of FKB238 versus Avastin.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: The event of interest was defined as death from any cause. OS was defined as the interval from date of randomization until the date of death due to any cause. OS was summarized using Kaplan-Meier estimates of the quartiles for each treatment arm, and 95% CIs for the medians were calculated.
outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
outcome.population: This assessment was performed using the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized).

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: The event of interest was defined as death from any cause. OS was defined as the interval from date of randomization until the date of death due to any cause. OS was summarized using Kaplan-Meier estimates of the quartiles for each treatment arm, and 95% CIs for the medians were calculated.
measure.population: This assessment was performed using the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized).

analysis.groups_desc: Hazard ratio and its 95% CI were calculated using the Cox regression model adjusting for baseline characteristics (randomization stratification factors, ECOG performance status at baseline, gender, smoking history and age) with ties handled by the Efron method.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Hazard ratio analysis of FKB238 versus Avastin.

outcome.title: Duration Of Response (DOR)
outcome.description: DOR was evaluated in this study as a secondary efficacy endpoint. Only the patients defined as responders in the primary analysis of ORR were taken into account for the analysis of DOR. The event of interest was defined as first documented disease progression or death due to any reason, whichever occurred first. DOR was defined as the interval from the first documented response (as defined per RECIST v1.1) until the earlier date of the first documented disease progression or death due to any reason. The date of first documented response was taken as the date of the first tumor assessment with an overall visit response of CR or PR. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. DOR was calculated in units of months.
outcome.time_frame: Until data cut-off, which occurred 12 months after randomization of the last patient enrolled, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.
outcome.population: This assessment of DOR was based on patients with events in the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized), and the BICR radiological assessments.

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Only the patients defined as responders in the primary analysis of ORR were taken into account for the analysis of DOR. The event of interest was defined as first documented disease progression or death due to any reason, whichever occurred first. DOR was defined as the interval from the first documented response (as defined per RECIST v1.1) until the earlier date of the first documented disease progression or death due to any reason. The date of first documented response was taken as the date of the first tumor assessment with an overall visit response of CR or PR. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions. DOR was calculated in units of months.

outcome.description: The DCR was defined as the proportion of patients defined as responders. The odds ratio for treatment (FKB238 arm versus Avastin arm) and the corresponding 95% Wald CI were produced based on a logistic regression analysis of DCR. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions; SD=neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum of diameters while on study. DCR=CR+PR+SD (≥ 6 weeks).

measure.title: Disease Control Rate (DCR) Assessed as the Proportion of Patients With a BOR of Either CR, PR, SD or NED
measure.description: The DCR was defined as the proportion of patients defined as responders. The number and percentage of responders and non-responders and the 95% Pearson-Clopper CI of DCR for each treatment arm was provided. The odds ratio for treatment (FKB238 arm versus Avastin arm) and the corresponding 95% Wald CI were produced based on a logistic regression analysis of DCR. Per RECIST v1.1 for target lesions and assessed by CT or, if contraindicated, MRI: CR=disappearance of all target lesions; PR=at least 30% decrease from baseline in the sum of diameters of target lesions; SD=neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum of diameters while on study. DCR=CR+PR+SD (≥ 6 weeks).
measure.population: This assessment of DCR was based on patients in the ITT population (patients included in each treatment arm as randomized), and the BICR radiological assessments.

analysis.groups_desc: The DCR was compared between treatment arms using logistic regression adjusting for baseline characteristics (randomization stratification factors, ECOG performance status at baseline, gender, smoking history and age).

outcome.title: Serum Trough Concentration (Ctrough)
outcome.description: Ctrough (pre-infusion) and serum maximum concentration (Cmax; at completion of infusion) were compared between treatment arms and time points, and descriptive statistics provided. Ctrough and Cmax concentrations were summarized using the pharmacokinetics (PK) population for each visit at which samples were taken. The pre-dose serum concentrations at Cycles 2, 4, and 6 were considered as Ctrough values and the post-dose serum concentrations at Cycles 1 and 4 were considered as Cmax values. PK data at Cycle 1 Day 1 pre-infusion were not calculable and are therefore not presented in the outcome measure data table. Data are only provided for the time points at which the serum trough concentration was measured.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 (pre- and post-infusion), Cycle 2 Day 1 (pre), Cycle 4 Day 1 (pre and post), Cycle 6 Day 1 (pre), discontinuation visit, and every 12 weeks (up to 1 year [±14 days] after randomisation) until death, or the patient was lost to follow-up.
outcome.population: All patients randomized to treatment who received at least 1 dose of investigational product with no important protocol deviations, and at least 1 serum drug concentration data after investigational product administration (PK population).

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

group.title: Avastin / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: Avastin: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Avastin (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

measure.title: Serum Trough Concentration (Ctrough)
measure.description: Ctrough (pre-infusion) and serum maximum concentration (Cmax; at completion of infusion) were compared between treatment arms and time points, and descriptive statistics provided. Ctrough and Cmax concentrations were summarized using the pharmacokinetics (PK) population for each visit at which samples were taken. The pre-dose serum concentrations at Cycles 2, 4, and 6 were considered as Ctrough values and the post-dose serum concentrations at Cycles 1 and 4 were considered as Cmax values. PK data at Cycle 1 Day 1 pre-infusion were not calculable and are therefore not presented in the outcome measure data table. Data are only provided for the time points at which the serum trough concentration was measured.
measure.population: All patients randomized to treatment who received at least 1 dose of investigational product with no important protocol deviations, and at least 1 serum drug concentration data after investigational product administration (PK population).

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients Developing Anti-drug Antibodies (ADAs)
outcome.description: The ADA levels were summarized at baseline and post-baseline time points using descriptive statistics.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Cycles 1, 2, 4 and 6, discontinuation visit, and every 12 weeks (up to 1 year [±14 days] after randomisation) until death, or the patient was lost to follow-up, whichever occurred first.
outcome.population: Includes all patients randomized to treatment who received at least 1 dose of investigational product with no important protocol deviations, and who had non-missing baseline ADA and at least 1 non-missing post-baseline ADA result (ADA evaluable population).

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin
group.description: Drug: FKB238: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. FKB238 (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

group.description: Drug: Avastin: 15 mg/kg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. Drug: Paclitaxel: 200 mg/m2 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Drug: Carboplatin: AUC = 6.0 IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for at least 4 and no more than 6 cycles. Avastin (bevacizumab) Paclitaxel Carboplatin

measure.title: Proportion of Patients Developing Anti-drug Antibodies (ADAs)
measure.description: The ADA levels were summarized at baseline and post-baseline time points using descriptive statistics.
measure.population: Includes all patients randomized to treatment who received at least 1 dose of investigational product with no important protocol deviations, and who had non-missing baseline ADA and at least 1 non-missing post-baseline ADA result (ADA evaluable population).

class.title: ADA prevalence (ADA positive, baseline or post)

outcome.title: Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.time_frame: From the time of signature of informed consent, throughout the treatment period and up to and including the 30-days after the last dose of study treatment, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months.

outcome.title: Vital Signs
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Hematology
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Clinical Chemistry
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Urinalysis
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Electrocardiogram
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Eastern Collaborative Oncology Group Performance Status
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Physical Examination
outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 30 days after last dose of study treatment.

reported_events.time_frame: From the time of signature of informed consent, throughout the treatment period and up to and including the 30-days after the last dose of study treatment, for a total estimated period of time of up to approximately 30 months. All ongoing and any new AEs/serious AEs (SAEs) identified during the 30 days after last dose were followed to resolution unless the event was considered by the investigator to be unlikely to resolve, or if the patient was lost to follow-up.
reported_events.desc: All safety summaries and analyses were based on the Safety Population. Adverse events (AEs) were coded using the latest Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities(MedDRA) version (21.1). AEs were categorized as treatment-emergent AEs. Intensity of AEs was assessed according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4 grading system.

group.title: FKB238 / Paclitaxel / Carboplatin

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publications/presentations made within 2 years of study completion require the Sponsor or CRO’s prior written consent. The Sponsor shall be provided with copies of any materials relating to the study that they intend to publish/present at least 30 days in advance of publication, submission or presentation and the Institution shall withhold publication, submission or presentation for 90 days from the date on which the Sponsor receives the material (total time-frame of 120 days).
